page.title: 13THE COASTGUARD STATION
page.content: On the Bristol Channel in the {West {End of Clevedon}there is a small coastguard station which is manned by 15 auxiliary coastguards. The most frequent type of incident is for overdue or missing craft although they get about four false alarms per year.Most of the alarms are at the weekend.The coastguard could be on duty anything from 20 minutes to 24 hours. Clevedon does not have a lifeboat. The nearest one is at Weston-Super-Mare or Portishead and it can take 15 minutes from Portishead or 30 from Weston. The coastguards all have different day jobs including a student,a baker,a doctor of physics,a computer engineer, a vicar,a plumber,a washing machine engineer,a pharmacist,a caterer and two retired people.
